sen.j: 横大路（よこおおじ）とは、奈良盆地を東西に貫く日本の古代道路。
sen.e: Yokooji is an ancient path in Japan that penetrated the Nara Basin in an east-west direction.
Yoko-oji Road is an ancient path in Japan that penetrated the Nara Basin in an east-west direction.
sen.cmt: Yoko-oji Road に訂正しました。
sen.e: Yoko-oji Road is an ancient path in Japan that penetrated the Nara Basin in an east-west direction.

sen.j: 「横大路」と呼ばれた道は、奈良盆地南部の藤原京付近を通っていた道 と 法隆寺付近から現在の天理市櫟本付近までの道の二つがある。
sen.e: There are two roads that were called Yokooji: one is the road that ran near Fujiwara-kyo in the south of the Nara Basin, and the other is the road than ran from the Horyu-ji Temple area to present-day Ichinomoto in Tenri City.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: There are two roads that were called 'Yoko-oji Road': one is the road that ran near Fujiwara-kyo in the south of the Nara Basin, and the other is the road than ran from the Horyu-ji Temple area to present-day Ichinomoto in Tenri City.
sen.cmt: Yoko-oji Road に訂正しました。原文の「」に合せて'を補足しました。
sen.e: There are two roads that were called 'Yoko-oji Road': one is the road that ran near Fujiwara-kyo in the south of the Nara Basin, and the other is the road than ran from the Horyu-ji Temple area to present-day Ichinomoto in Tenri City.

sen.j: 通常は前者のことを指し、後者は「北の横大路」と区別される。
sen.e: Usually Yokooji refers to the former one and the latter is distinguished as Kita no Yoko-oji.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Usually Yoko-oji refers to the former one and the latter is distinguished as 'Kita no Yoko-oji.'
sen.cmt: ハイフン補足しました。原文の「」に合せて'を補足しました。
sen.e: Usually Yoko-oji refers to the former one and the latter is distinguished as 'Kita no Yoko-oji.'

sen.j: 横大路（伊勢街道）
sen.e: Yokooji (Ise-Kaido Road)
Yoko-oji Road (Ise-kaido Road)
sen.cmt: Yoko-oji Road に訂正しました。kaido 小文字にしました。
sen.e: Yoko-oji Road (Ise-kaido Road)

sen.j: 通常「横大路」と呼ばれる道は、桜井市の三輪山の南から葛城市の二上山 (奈良県・大阪府)付近まで東西にほぼまっすぐに設置された道である。
sen.e: As a general rule, the road called Yokooji is the almost straight road that stretches in an east-west direction from the south of Mt. Miwa in Sakurai City and reaches the area around Mt. Nijo in Katsuragi City (Nara Prefecture and Osaka Prefecture).

As a general rule, the road called 'Yoko-oji Road' is the almost straight road that stretches in an east-west direction from the south of Mt. Miwa in Sakurai City and reaches the area around Mt. Nijo in Katsuragi City (Nara Prefecture and Osaka Prefecture).
sen.cmt: Yoko-oji Road に訂正しました。原文の「」に合せて'を補足しました。
sen.e: As a general rule, the road called 'Yoko-oji Road' is the almost straight road that stretches in an east-west direction from the south of Mt. Miwa in Sakurai City and reaches the area around Mt. Nijo in Katsuragi City (Nara Prefecture and Osaka Prefecture).

sen.j: 別名として、伊勢街道（伊勢本街道）とも呼ばれる。
sen.e: It is also called Ise-hon-kaido Road.
It is also called Ise-kaido Road (Ise Hon-kaido Road).
sen.cmt: kaido 小文字にしました。Ise-kaido Road (Ise Hon-kaido Road)に訂正しました。
sen.e: It is also called Ise-kaido Road (Ise Hon-kaido Road).

sen.j: 現在の国道166号線の一部区間そのもの、および国道に平行している。
sen.e: Most part of the road corresponds to or runs parallel to present-day Route 166.
Most part of the road corresponds to or runs parallel to present-day Route 166.
Most part of the road corresponds to or runs parallel to present-day Route 166.

sen.j: 東側では伊勢国への伊勢参宮街道および初瀬街道に、西側では和泉国に至る竹内街道および長尾街道に接続する。
sen.e: At the eastern end, the road connects to the Ise Shrine Pilgrimage Road and Hase Kaido Road, and at the western end, it connects to Takenouchi-kaido Road and Nagao-kaido Road.
At the eastern end, the road connects to the Ise Shrine Pilgrimage Road and Hase-kaido Road, and at the western end, it connects to Takenouchi-kaido Road and Nagao-kaido Road.
At the eastern end, the road connects to the Ise Shrine Pilgrimage Road and Hase-kaido Road, and at the western end, it connects to Takenouchi-kaido Road and Nagao-kaido Road.

sen.j: 神武天皇が墨坂の神に赤楯矛を、大坂（都市の大坂ではなく、二上山の北の峠）の神に黒楯矛を奉った。
sen.e: The Emperor Jinmu enshrined red pikes and shields as the god of Sumisaka and black pikes and shields as the god of Osaka (not the city of Osaka but the north pass of Mt. Nijo).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The Emperor Jinmu enshrined red pikes and shields as the god of Sumisaka and black pikes and shields as the god of Osaka (not the city of Osaka but the north pass of Mt. Nijo).
The Emperor Jinmu enshrined red pikes and shields as the god of Sumisaka and black pikes and shields as the god of Osaka (not the city of Osaka but the north pass of Mt. Nijo).

sen.j: これは、両地を結ぶ横大路が初期大和朝廷にとって重要であったことを示しているとされる。
sen.e: It is said that this is because Yokooji that connected those two places had an important meaning for the first Yamato regime.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: It is said that this is because Yoko-oji Road that connected those two places had an important meaning for the first Yamato regime.
sen.cmt: Yoko-oji Road に訂正しました。
sen.e: It is said that this is because Yoko-oji Road that connected those two places had an important meaning for the first Yamato regime.

sen.j: 都が飛鳥京、藤原京にあった時代には多くの外交使節も利用した。
sen.e: When the capital was located at Asuka-kyo and Fujiwara-kyo, many envoys used this road.
When the capital was located at Asuka-kyo and Fujiwara-kyo, many envoys used this road.
When the capital was located at Asuka-kyo and Fujiwara-kyo, many envoys used this road.

sen.j: 江戸時代には伊勢神宮へのお蔭参りの参道として賑わった。
sen.e: During the Edo period, it prospered as the approach of okage mairi (a group pilgrimage to the Ise-jingu Shrine).
During the Edo period, it prospered as the approach of okage mairi (a group pilgrimage to the Ise-jingu Shrine).
During the Edo period, it prospered as the approach of okage mairi (a group pilgrimage to the Ise-jingu Shrine).

sen.j: 横大路は、東から、上街道 (上ツ道)、太子道（筋違道）、中ツ道、中街道 (下ツ道)、下街道 (奈良県)等と交差する。
sen.e: Yokooji crosses with these roads from the east: the Kami Kaido (Kamitsu Michi), Taishimichi (Sujikaimichi Road), Nakatsu Michi, the Naka Kaido (Shimotsu Michi), and the Shimo Kaido (Nara Prefecture).
sen.cmt: 法隆寺街道とあるのはリンク先の単語で、ウェブ上の単語は「太子道（筋違道）」となっていますので、これで訳出しています（これを採用しないと後の「太子道以外は...」につながらない）。
sen.e: Yoko-oji Road crosses with these roads from the east: The Kami-kaido (Kamitsu Michi), Taishimichi (Sujikaimichi Road), Nakatsu Michi, the Naka-kaido (Shimotsu Michi), and the Shimo-kaido (Nara Prefecture).
sen.cmt: Yoko-oji Road に訂正しました。The大文字にしました。-kaidoに訂正しました。
sen.e: Yoko-oji Road crosses with these roads from the east: The Kami-kaido (Kamitsu Michi), Taishimichi (Sujikaimichi Road), Nakatsu Michi, the Naka-kaido (Shimotsu Michi), and the Shimo-kaido (Nara Prefecture).

sen.j: 太子道以外は奈良盆地を南北に貫いている。
sen.e: These roads penetrate the Nara Basin in a north-south direction, except the Taishimichi.
These roads penetrate the Nara Basin in a north-south direction, except the Taishi Michi.
sen.cmt: Taishi Michi に訂正しました。
sen.e: These roads penetrate the Nara Basin in a north-south direction, except the Taishi Michi.

sen.j: 川も、東から大和川、寺川、米川、飛鳥川 (奈良県)、曽我川、葛城川、高田川、葛下川等をまたぐ。
sen.e: The road goes over these rivers from the east: Tera-kawa River, Yone-gawa River, Asuka-gawa River (Nara Prefecture), Soga-gawa River, Katsuragi-gawa River, Takada-gawa River and Katsuge-gawa River.
The road goes over these rivers from the east: Tera-kawa River, Yone-gawa River, Asuka-gawa River (Nara Prefecture), Soga-gawa River, Katsuragi-gawa River, Takada-gawa River and Katsuge-gawa River.
The road goes over these rivers from the east: Tera-kawa River, Yone-gawa River, Asuka-gawa River (Nara Prefecture), Soga-gawa River, Katsuragi-gawa River, Takada-gawa River and Katsuge-gawa River.

sen.j: 横大路から北は、川の流路が整う様に見えることから、また、下ツ道と下街道の間が離れていることから、古代には、奈良盆地の真中に、湖ないしは池の様な湿地帯があったのではないかと推測されている。
sen.e: It is supposed that in the ancient times there was a lake or a marsh like a pond in the middle of the Nara Basin, since the rivers seemed tidy in the areas north of Yokooji and there was a distance between Shimotsu Michi and the Shimo Kaido.

It is supposed that in the ancient times there was a lake or a marsh like a pond in the middle of the Nara Basin, since the rivers seemed tidy in the areas north of Yoko-oji Road and there was a distance between Shimotsu Michi and the Shimo-kaido.
sen.cmt: Yoko-oji Road に訂正しました。-kaidoに訂正しました。
sen.e: It is supposed that in the ancient times there was a lake or a marsh like a pond in the middle of the Nara Basin, since the rivers seemed tidy in the areas north of Yoko-oji Road and there was a distance between Shimotsu Michi and the Shimo-kaido.

sen.j: 北の横大路
sen.e: Kita no Yoko-oji
Kita no Yoko-oji
Kita no Yoko-oji

sen.j: 北の横大路とされる道は、斑鳩町の法隆寺付近から天理市の櫟本までまっすぐ東西に通っていた道である。
sen.e: Kita no Yoko-oji was the straight road that stretched from Horyu-ji Temple area in Ikaruga Town to Ichinomoto in Tenri City in an east-west direction.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Kita no Yoko-oji was the straight road that stretched from Horyu-ji Temple area in Ikaruga Town to Ichinomoto in Tenri City in an east-west direction.
Kita no Yoko-oji was the straight road that stretched from Horyu-ji Temple area in Ikaruga Town to Ichinomoto in Tenri City in an east-west direction.

sen.j: 現在の国道25号線の一部と奈良県道192号福住横田線の一部区間に相当する。
sen.e: It corresponds to the parts of present-day Route 25 and Nara Prefectural Road 192, Fukusumi-Yokota line.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: It corresponds to the parts of present-day Route 25 and Nara Prefectural Road 192, Fukusumi-Yokota line.
It corresponds to the parts of present-day Route 25 and Nara Prefectural Road 192, Fukusumi-Yokota line.

sen.j: 別名として、業平道とも呼ばれる。
sen.e: It is also called Narihira-michi Road.
It is also called Narihira-michi Road.
It is also called Narihira-michi Road.

sen.j: 西側で竜田越奈良街道に接続する。
sen.e: At the western end, it connects to Tatsutagoe-Nara—kaido Road.
At the western end, it connects to Tatsutagoe Nara—kaido Road.
sen.cmt: ハイフン削除し、スペース補足しました。
sen.e: At the western end, it connects to Tatsutagoe Nara—kaido Road.
